page.title: 07EDUCATION IN BALFRON AREA
page.content: Until 1981, Balfron had an"omnibus" school; that is the{primary}and secondary pupils were taught in one school under the same headmaster. The separate primary school,semi-open plan in design, was opened in 1981. Both schools still wear the same{uniform}of brown skirt or trousers, yellow blouse or shirt and a brown, gold and green striped tie. The badge shows hills and a wolf's head, depicting the story of the wolves devouring the children. The school{motto}is "Unde Salus Mea"-"From whence doth come mine aid", Psalm 121. About 154 pupils attend the primary school,27 of them travelling by bus. The school is{staffed} by the head- mistress;7 class-teachers;4 visiting teachers for Music,Art,Physical Educ. and Needlework;and 2 visiting teachers for remedial and handicapped children, (Warnock Report implementation).
